byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti and Jonathan Martin contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A picture has emerged of a field of declared and likely candidates that sound hawkish about fighting the Islamic State, yet are reluctant and even evasive when it comes to laying out detailed plans.

headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Rivals Skirt Specifics on ISIS Fight
headline.main: Republican Rivals Skirt Specifics on Plans to Fight ISIS

snippet: A picture has emerged of a field of declared and likely candidates that sound hawkish about fighting the Islamic State, yet are reluctant and even evasive when it comes to laying out detailed plans.
abstract: Republican presidential hopefuls are quick to criticize Pres Obama's war strategy, yet offer no plans of their own on how to fight Islamic State; most have pledged to pursue diplomatic options to counter ISIS rather than make military commitments.
